name: PCB & Packaging
description: Sector template for PCB and semiconductor packaging patents including substrates, interconnects, and assembly.
contextDescription: PCB and packaging patents cover the physical assembly and interconnection of semiconductor devices. Key areas include PCB design (H05K), chip packaging (flip-chip, BGA, CSP), advanced packaging (2.5D, 3D, chiplets), and interconnects. High-value targets include OSAT vendors (ASE, Amkor), substrate suppliers, and advanced packaging leaders (TSMC CoWoS, Intel EMIB).
scoringGuidance: Advanced packaging patents (2.5D, 3D, chiplets) are high-value growth area.
High-density interconnect patents target mobile and compute applications.
Thermal management patents are critical for high-power devices.
Substrate patents target Japanese/Taiwanese substrate suppliers.
Consider both design and manufacturing patents.

questions.question: What packaging technology does this patent cover? Score: 1-3 for legacy, 4-6 for standard (BGA, QFN), 7-10 for advanced (2.5D, 3D, chiplets).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the packaging technology and market trend.

questions.question: Is this patent relevant to advanced packaging (CoWoS, EMIB, chiplets)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Advanced packaging is a key growth area. Assess applicability.

questions.question: Does this patent address thermal management in packaging?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Thermal is critical for high-power chips.
